question_title: Will 95% or more of Nigerians have a bank account before 2025?
summary: This is a definitional question where the deadline (January 1, 2025) has passed. The 2023 A2F Survey shows only 52% of Nigerian adults have bank accounts, with broader financial inclusion at 64-74%. The 95% target set by the Central Bank Governor in 2019 was not achieved - the gap is 21-43 percentage points. All available data sources (EFInA, World Bank, Bloomberg) converge on this conclusion. The question will resolve NO unless completely unexpected contradictory data emerges, which is extremely unlikely.

factors.description: A2F 2023 Survey shows 52% bank account ownership - far below 95% target
Even broadest financial inclusion measure (74%) is 21pp below 95% threshold
Historical growth rate (~2pp/year) was insufficient to close 55pp gap
Multiple credible sources converge on same data (EFInA, World Bank, Bloomberg)
Community prediction on original Metaculus question is 0.1% (strong prior)
